Combust.name: Combust
Combust.description:
Combust class always maintains a path to part of the database and has various methods for reading and writing data to it,
as well as listening for changes in data at the specified path.

classitems.description:
Change the path of the Combust object to point to one of the children of the current path.
Method is chainable.
classitems.name: child

params.name: childName
params.description: childName Name of the child of the current path to point Combust at

return.description: Returns a mutated instance of the same Combust instance so that it can be chained.

classitems.description: Pushes an object as a new child at the current path.
classitems.name: push

params.name: object
params.description: object The object to push as a new child at the current path.

params.name: *callback
params.description: callback The callback to be executed once the new child has been synchronized with the database. Optional parameter.

return.description: Returns a new instance of Combust that points to the path of the newly created child.

classitems.description: Deletes an object at the current path
classitems.name: delete

params.name: object
params.description: object The object to be delete from database at the current path.

params.name: *callback
params.description: callback The callback to be exectued once the object has been set at the path in the database. Optional parameter.

classitems.description: Sets an object at the current path.
classitems.name: set

params.name: object
params.description: object The object to set at the current path.

params.name: *callback
params.description: callback The callback to be executed once the object has been set at the path in the database. Optional parameter.

classitems.description: Creates an event listener for a specified event at the current path.
classitems.name: on

params.name: eventType
params.description: eventType The type of event to listen for at the current path.

params.name: *callback
params.description: callback(newChild) The callback to be executed once the specified event is triggered. Accepts the new child as the only parameter.
